title: Multiply Strings
description: Given two non-negative integers num1 and num2 represented as strings, return the product of num1 and num2, also represented as a string. Note: You must not use any built-in BigInteger library or convert the inputs to integer directly.
constraints: num1 and num2 consist of digits only.
Both num1 and num2 do not contain any leading zero, except the number 0 itself.

brute-force.name: Conversion (Not Allowed)
brute-force.description: Convert to int, multiply, convert back. (Violates constraints)

steps.instruction: Define the function multiply that takes num1 and num2.

steps.hint: Convert strings to integers, multiply them, and convert back to string. Note: This approach is not allowed by the problem constraints.

steps.instruction: Define the function multiply that takes num1 and num2.

steps.placeholderCode:
res = [0] * (len(num1) + len(num2))
    num1, num2 = num1[::-1], num2[::-1]
steps.hint: Create a result array of size `len(num1) + len(num2)` initialized with zeros. Reverse both strings to simplify index calculations.
steps.solutionCode:
res = [0] * (len(num1) + len(num2))
    num1, num2 = num1[::-1], num2[::-1]

steps.hint: Iterate through each digit of both numbers, multiply them, and add the result to the corresponding position in the `res` array. Handle carry-over.
Reverse the result array, skip leading zeros, convert digits to strings, and join them.
